title: French SSA startup Aldoria raises $10.9 million
summary: A French startup developing a space situational awareness (SSA) system has raised $10.9 million to build out its tracking network.

title: UK Space Agency Launches Challenge to Purify Lunar Water
summary:
The UK Space Agency, in partnership with its Canadian counterpart, has launched the £1.2 million, which aims to support the development of technology that would enable the extraction of purified water from ice buried beneath the lunar surface. “The UK is playing an important role in the NASA-led Artemis Missions, which aim to establish a […]
The post UK Space Agency Launches Challenge to Purify Lunar Water appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Industry report calls for greater use of AI to extract untapped value from satellite data
summary: Companies in the Earth observation satellite industry are looking for climate-focused customers that could leverage data from space to generate value for their businesses and for the planet.

title: Launch Roundup – Northrop Grumman prepare the first Cygnus to fly on Falcon 9
summary: Recent challenges with weather concerns and the movement of key flights such as USSF-52 and Axiom-3 have impacted Falcon 9 launch dates, not least Starlink Group 7-11 which scrubbed three times and is now awaiting launch on Tuesday.

title: Video Replay – Not Invisible Anymore: How satellites monitor atmospheric methane
